K-Bank, South Korea's internet-only bank, reported a 15.5% year-on-year drop in cumulative net profit for Q3 2025, but saw non-interest income surge over 90% as deposits and corporate loans hit record highs.

K-Bank has filed for its third IPO attempt, with institutional investors closely watching the 15-day lockup valuation amid concerns over existing share sales, Upbit deposit reliance, and market conditions as multiple year-end IPOs approach.
